paper_abstract: Let G = (V, E) be a simple connected graph with vertex set V(G) and edge set E(G). The second GA and (Sz)(lambda) indices a graph G are defined as GA(2)(G) = Sigma(e=uv is an element of E(G)) 2 root n(u)(e)n(v)(e)/n(u)(e) + n(v)(e), Sz(lambda)(G) = Sz(lambda) = Sigma(e=uv is an element of E(G)) [n(u)(e)n(v)(e)](lambda), where n(u)(e) is the number of vertices closer to u than v and n(v)(e) is the number of vertices closer to v than u. In this paper, some relations between the second GA index, (Sz)(-1) and (Sz()-1/2) of G are studied.
paper_title: Some Relations Between the Second GA Index, (Sz)(-1)-Index, and (Sz)(-1/2)-Index of Graphs
